intro: Ceropegia tristis, commonly known as the pale ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, pale green to yellowish flowers that are often overlooked due to their subdued color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Ceropegia tristis is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique foliage and low maintenance requirements.
